data.title: Open Terminal at Root: cmd inherits Atom environment variables
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
* [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
* [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
* [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
* [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
* [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.

### Description

I've been wondering why, when I open a windows CMD from Atom with the `Open Terminal at Root` feature, my `npm install` only installs dependencies and not devDependencies. It turns out the `NODE_ENV` environment variable is set to `production`, which is, I guess, inherited from the Atom process.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Right click on your top folder
2. Click Open Terminal at Root
3. Type `echo %NODE_ENV%`

**Expected behavior:** `NODE_ENV` is not defined on my machine, so I should actually see `%NODE_ENV%`

**Actual behavior:** `production` is printed

### Versions

Windows 10 Home x64 (version 1607 build 14393.447)

>Atom    : 1.12.5
Electron: 1.3.9
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0

>apm  1.12.9
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.12
git 2.10.1.windows.1
visual studio 2015

data.title: Enhancement: Allow 'Reveal in Treeview' for not selected files
data.body: Sometimes, it's useful to check where a file different from the current on view is placed in the treeview. This enhancement aims to add to the dropdown the 'Reveal in the Treeview' option when the user clicks with the right button. - Menu in the current selected file: - Menu in a not selected file:

data.title: building i386 on debian
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
* [ ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
* [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
* [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
* [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
* [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.

### Description

while building on Debian 8 i386 platform i get the following error:

root@debian8-i386:~/atom# ./script/build

/root/atom/script/build:13
const yargs = require('yargs')
^^^^^
SyntaxError: Use of const in strict mode.
    at Module._compile (module.js:439:25)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:474:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:356:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:312:12)
    at Function.Module.runMain (module.js:497:10)
    at startup (node.js:119:16)
    at node.js:906:3
root@debian8-i386:~/atom# which node
/usr/bin/node
root@debian8-i386:~/atom# ls -la /usr/bin/node
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 15 Nov 22 13:19 /usr/bin/node -> /usr/bin/nodejs
root@debian8-i386:~/atom# ls -al /usr/bin/nodejs
-rwxr-xr-x 1 root root 1265044 Apr 12  2015 /usr/bin/nodejs
root@debian8-i386:~/atom# /usr/bin/nodejs -v
v0.10.29
root@debian8-i386:~/atom# 


I have built it on Ubuntu 16 i386, but when trying to install the Debian package, it says that it's an unknown format.

[Description of the bug or feature]

### Steps to Reproduce

2. [Second Step]
3. [and so on...]

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.title: GPG signatures for source validation
data.body:
As we all know, today more than ever before, it is crucial to be able to trust our computing environments. One of the main difficulties that package maintainers of Linux distributions face, is the difficulty to verify the authenticity and the integrity of the source code.

The Arch Linux team would appreciate it if you would provide us GPG signatures in order to verify easily and quickly of your source code releases.

**Overview of the required tasks:**
* Please [create and/or use a 4096-bit RSA keypair](https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/GnuPG#Create_key_pair) for the file signing
* The key may be used for [email encryption](https://www.enigmail.net/index.php/en/) too
* Keep your key secret, use a strong unique passphrase for the key
* [Sign every new commit by default](https://help.github.com/articles/signing-commits-using-gpg/)
* [Sign new tags](https://help.github.com/articles/signing-tags-using-gpg/)
* Verify the Github Release tarball download against your local source
* [Sign Github Release tarballs](https://wiki.debian.org/Creating%20signed%20GitHub%20releases)

**Additional Information: **
* https://help.github.com/categories/gpg/
* https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Tools-Signing-Your-Work https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/verifying-signatures/
* https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/security/encrypt-in-transit/why-https

Thanks.

data.title: Include relatedTarget when dispatching blur events from editor elements
data.body:
Refs: #13254 

~~In atom-space-pen-views, on require, we call `atom.themes.requireStylesheet` to include a default style sheet for the select list. Now that we are planning to replace all usages of space pen with a more modern alternative (https://github.com/atom/atom-select-list), I believe a better design can be achieved by including a default style sheet in Atom core instead of relying on a require-time call to the `ThemeManager`.~~

This pull request introduces a `relatedTarget` option in the synthesized blur event of `TextEditorElement` to make it easier for users of this API to know the value of `document.activeElement` after the event dispatch. We will use this in atom-select-list to [determine if the user has clicked outside the select list](https://github.com/atom/atom-select-list/blob/fa20fdc7d0763a02aa2f1e2385f8f61e0063eb65/src/select-list-view.js#L35-L41) and, if so, trigger a `didCancelSelection` event.

/cc: @atom/maintainers

data.title: OSX "Open With" context menu shows multiple versions of Atom
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [X ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
* [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
* [X ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)? No
* [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
* [X] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
* [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.

### Description
In macOS Finder when I right click a file and hover over "Open With" I get multiple versions of Atom listed even though I only have one version installed.


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Right click file in Finder
2. Hover "Open With"

**Expected behavior:** 
To only see one version of Atom

**Actual behavior:**
I see multiple versions

### Versions
Atom    : 1.12.3
Electron: 1.3.6
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.3.0
apm  1.12.9
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.10
git 2.8.4

OS X El Capitan 10.11.6

data.title: Button "/" considered as "."
data.body:
I'm not sure is it bug with Atom, but I have this issue since i changed OS to ArchLinux and installed the Atom. 
So problem is when I push "Ctrl+/" it considers this as "Ctrl-.". I thought if I'll press "Ctrl+." it will be consider this as "Ctrl+/" but no! 
I think it probably something went wrong with my keyboard layout.

Can someone guide me to the right point?

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'unmodified' of undefined
data.body:
**Steps to reproduce**

Prerequisites: Ubuntu 16.04 with Gnome.

1. Open `Region & Lanugage` settings from the Gnome settings.
1. Add the `Thai (TIS-820.2538)` layout and make sure it is the top layout in the `Region & Language` settings.
1. Open Atom and type any character.

This issue was previously fixed for Windows in https://github.com/atom/keyboard-layout/pull/23 but seems to also be an issue on Linux.

![screenshot from 2016-12-25 21-33-32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1058982/21472801/314d5804-caea-11e6-823c-b30571d98e5d.png)

----

IF i press any shortcut such as CTRL + C or CTRL + P
i see this msg : 
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'unmodified' of undefined

**Atom Version**: 1.12.5
**Electron Version**: 1.3.9
**System**: Microsoft Windows 7 Home Premium 
**Thrown From**: Atom Core


### Stack Trace

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'unmodified' of undefined

```
At C:\Users\Z\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.12.5\resources\app.asar\node_modules\atom-keymap\lib\helpers.js:45

TypeError: Cannot read property 'unmodified' of undefined
    at isLatinKeymap (C:\Users\Z\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.12.5\resources\app.asar\node_modules\atom-keymap\lib\helpers.js:45:45)
    at exports.keystrokeForKeyboardEvent (C:\Users\Z\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.12.5\resources\app.asar\node_modules\atom-keymap\lib\helpers.js:243:31)
    at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.keystrokeForKeyboardEvent (C:\Users\Z\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.12.5\resources\app.asar\node_modules\atom-keymap\lib\keymap-manager.js:433:14)
    at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.handleKeyboardEvent (C:\Users\Z\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.12.5\resources\app.asar\node_modules\atom-keymap\lib\keymap-manager.js:321:24)
    at WindowEventHandler.module.exports.WindowEventHandler.handleDocumentKeyEvent (C:\Users\Z\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.12.5\resources\app.asar\src\window-event-handler.js:106:36)
    at HTMLDocument.<anonymous> (C:\Users\Z\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.12.5\resources\app.asar\src\window-event-handler.js:3:59)
```

### Commands

```
     -8:52.1.0 command-palette:toggle (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
 10x -8:46.1.0 core:backspace (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -8:35 application:open-your-keymap (atom-text-editor.editor)
 43x -8:32.3.0 core:move-down (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
undefined -8:30.3.0 core:move-up (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
```

### Config

```json
{}
```

### Installed Packages

```coffee

atom-dark-syntax, v0.27.0 (inactive)
```

data.title: Additional quotes on win32 in BufferedProcess
data.body:
I am trying to run a simple bat ( for a linter ) and at the BufferedProcess execution try I get the process variables that look like this
Command : C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe"
Parameter of execution :
""C:\Windows\System32\jolie.bat "--check" "C:\Progetti\PortaleManutenzioneAndroid\Leonardo\leonardo.ol"""

Where the Linter execution path is 'C:\Windows\System32\jolie.bat'

It is symilar to the problem raised on #3208

my Atom version is 1.12.4

Regards 
Balint

data.title: HTML Syntax Colour Bug
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
* [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
* [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
* [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
* [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
* [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.

### Description

I built an HTML file, contains three longer Javascript scripts, three longer base64 encoded images and two base64 encoded fonts. But everything isn't colourful. I analysed every code and I didn't find any issue. 

In other code editors, everything works and is colourful.

I believed that it is a bug. 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. I copied carefully and correctly base64 codes to img and font and it was still colourful.
2. I copied one or two scripts and it was still colourful. But the second script caused the conflict, not allowing me to fold (hide) the Javascript script tags. I switched to another editor, for fixing an issue and copied the third script. 
3. I open the same file with Atom and I saw that it wasn't colourful. But still colourful in that other editor. 

### Versions
Atom:                 1.12.5
Electron:            1.3.9
Chrome :            52.0.2743.82
Node:                 6.5.0

apm      1.12.9
npm      3.10.5
node     4.4.5
python  2.7.12
git.         2.9.3

macOS Sierra 10.10

![screen shot 2016-11-22 at 05 05 37](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2257024/20514490/49a1bb70-b073-11e6-8e46-7c3ca6033021.png)

data.title: Add Flatpak support
data.body:
This PR adds support for building a [flatpak](http://flatpak.org/) for atom. See the feature request issue https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/11837

First time contributing, so please let me know if there is anything else I should do to get this in ship shape. I did not see any tests for other packaging scripts (e.g. create-debian-package.js) so I did not add any here.

A broader conversation should probably happen around how the library dependencies for the app are included. The build script here will try to download an electron "base application" which contains things like gtk and libnotify which are needed by any electron app.

This base app can grow with new dependencies of the electron project and contain bug fixes specific to electron. It allows anyone shipping an electron flatpak to avoid library quirks on different linux distributions. It does need to be hosted somewhere though.

For now, the flatpak recipe for building the electron base app is here
https://github.com/endlessm/electron-flatpak-base-app
and my company [endless computers](https://endlessm.com/) is hosting a compiled version of the base app on s3 here
https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/electron-flatpak.endlessm.com/electron-base-app-master.flatpakref

If there is interest, it would be fantastic if atom/electron project could be the official home of the electron base app going forward. We'd be happy to transfer the github repository and help with setting up a place to host the compiled version of the electron base application. Please ping me to discuss further. I can open a follow up issue in the electron repository if that is best.

On a related note, have started work on some [node tools for building electron flatpaks](https://www.npmjs.com/~endlessm), and have a few [other](https://github.com/mattdangerw/webtorrent-desktop/tree/flatpak) [app](https://github.com/mattdangerw/brave-browser-laptop/tree/flatpak) [ports](https://github.com/mattdangerw/Ghost-Desktop/tree/flatpak) in progress.

#### Building
Requires [flatpak > `0.6.13` installed](http://flatpak.org/getting.html). Then just
```
./script/build --create-flatpak
```

#### Testing
Install the flatpak and run it with
```
flatpak install --user --bundle out/atom-x86_64.flatpak
flatpak run io.atom.Atom
```

data.title: Uncaught Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, lstat '~/Downloads/Atom.app'
data.body:

2. ...

**Atom Version**: 1.12.5

**System**: Mac OS X 10.11.5

data.title: Upgrade scandal
data.body: Refs atom/scandal#40

data.title: Add libXScrnSaver dependency to the RPM package spec
data.body:
Fixes #13176.

/cc: @atom/maintainers

data.title: Call `openDevTools` on `WebContents` rather than on `BrowserWindow`
data.body:
Fixes #13171.

This probably broke after upgrading electron but, since it's a code path we rarely touch, it went unnoticed.

/cc: @atom/maintainers

data.title: Update documentation for GitRepository::getConfigValue
data.body: Adds the `key` argument to the function documentation

data.title: Quitting 2 Windows at once stores only one of them
data.body:
### Description
I Open Two windows of Atom: One has a Julia console and a file open, the other Window has 2 files open. 
When I close Atom (either by File->Exit or by Application: Quit in the cmd), both Windows close. When I re-open Atom, using the same shortcut all the time of course, two windows open. However, BOTH windows have THE SAME things on them: either the console and one script or the two other scripts.

### Steps to Reproduce
Explained by my description

**Expected behavior:** Both Windows should be restored, each with their respective content.

**Actual behavior:** Both windows were restored, both with the SAME content!

### Versions
(Atom is on auto-update)
Windows 10 64bit

data.title: Ability to *enforce* preferences for all users.
data.body:
### Description

#13284 is a request to be able to provide a default value for preferences at the machine level rather than user or application level. In some cases, we'd like to enforce settings even if users have them set to a non-default value. Particularly in the case of something like backing up before saving, this is something that should be turned on for all our managed machines, not just defaulted to on.

This request is for a way to mark certain machine-wide preferences as being enforced rather than optional so that Atom would ignore a user's setting of a preference.

### Versions

1.10 and all previous versions on all OSes

data.title: Ability to set preferences for all users of machine
data.body:
### Description

It recently came up that a user lost work because of #9166 and I wanted to be able to roll out a preference to our machines that would default saving with back up to true. Apparently there's no way to read a system-wide configuration file in Atom, and it relies entirely on configuration in the user's home directory.

I'd like Atom to be able to have an extra layer of preferences, so that if something is not set by the user, it is read from a per-machine configuration, before using the application's default settings. On Linux this should be a file in /etc, but it could be registry entries on Windows or some other file in the application data area.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Wish to set a preference across users
2. Not have the ability.

**Expected behavior:** Be able to default a preference for all users

**Actual behavior:** Only per-user configuration is taken into account

### Versions

1.10 and all previous, all OSes.

data.title: Atom spawning zsh which consumes 100% CPU and other bugs in latest version 1.12.4-1
data.body:
I am using Arch Linux with GNOME v3.22.2, Atom v1.12.4-1, apm v1.14.1-1, ZSH v5.2-1 (ZSH is my default shell)  
With last upgrade: 
1. Atom ( v1.12.4-1) is spawning  ZSH as child process and this ZSH process is consuming 100% CPU continuously. (screen shot below)

![screenshot from 2016-11-20 00-03-40](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15322797/20461683/620973e0-af2b-11e6-8333-12b3ffd4fa5d.png)

But when I close Atom editor, this ZSH process becomes child of PID 1 (systemd) (screen shot below) and still consumes 100% CPU

![screenshot from 2016-11-19 17-16-42](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15322797/20461696/b266c68a-af2b-11e6-969c-fd8ae275d35d.png)

2. I cannot open Settings tab from Menu > Edit > Preferences, instead I have to use keyboard shortcut Ctrl + ,

3. I cannot create new file from menu nor open a file from folder not in project folder.

**Please note**: these all problems go away if I run Atom in safe mode. I tried removing `~/.atom` folder and installing all packages again but I still face these problems.

Please ask me for details in case I have not included them here, thanks for your help.

`Update`: Starting atom with `----clear-window-state` once did not help.

data.title: Error: spawn clang ENOENT  in saving the c++ file.
File > Reopen Project. Option to reopen in current window.
data.body:
Currently, choosing `File > Reopen Project > [MyProject]` reopens the chosen project in a new window.

I request an option to have it open in the same window (unloading the currently loaded project then loading the chosen project).

I'm on:

Atom 1.13.0-beta4.
Windows 10 Pro.
